page.title: 13LANDSCAPE W'BOURNE VALLEY
page.content: {COUNTRYSIDE}Arable Downland with small deciduous woods and field hedgerows.To the north, in a steeply wooded valley, lies attractive Steepleton village beside the Winterbourne stream. To the south undulating fields gradually rise to meet gorse-clad Bronkham Ridge and Blackdown Hill whose coniferous sides and heather crest are topped by the Hardy Monument. {VIEWPOINT} Blackdown commands splendid panoramic views inland to the distant hills of Bulbarrow, Lewesdon and highest 279m Pilsden Pen. Seaward the eye can range from Portland and famous Chesil Beach westward to Golden Cap cliff and the Devon coast beyond Lyme Regis. {BUILDINGS} Most architectural interest centered in Steepleton where a lovely Tudor farmhouse with C17 window stands near fine C16 stone cottages,old water mill,imposing C19 Manor House,Rectory.
